metadata.title: CVE-2022-32744 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Samba. The KDC accepts kpasswd requests encrypted withany key known to it. By encrypting forged kpasswd requests with its ownkey, a user can change other users' passwords, enabling full domaintakeover.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libnss-winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libpam-winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libsmbclient - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
libwbclient0 - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
python3-samba - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
registry-tools - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-common - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-common-bin - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-libs - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-testsuite - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
smbclient - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
winbind - 2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.15.9+dfsg-0ubuntu0.2').
